description: Canada’s transport minister said he is determined to get to the bottom of a recent train delay that left Via Rail passengers stranded for about 10 hours in Quebec over the long weekend. Pablo Rodriguez said he is meeting with Via Rail leadership this week. “Passengers deserve better,” Rodriguez said Sunday on X. Via Rail […]
title: Canada’s Transport Minister to Meet With Via Rail After Passengers Stranded 10 Hours

description: The NFL Brazil Game will see the Philadelphia Eagles facing the Green Bay Packers on Friday.
title: NFL Continues to Expand Its International Footprint With Game in Brazil

description: The campaign began following a deal between the WHO and Israel, which agreed to limited pauses in the fighting to allow vaccination centers to operate.
title: UN Begins Mass Polio Vaccination Campaign in Gaza After Disease’s Reemergence

description: The federal government and the City of Toronto have announced a joint investment of over $323 million to build flood protection infrastructure in a Toronto neighbourhood prone to severe flooding. The targeted area is Rockcliffe-Smythe, along Black Creek in northwest Toronto, a neighbourhood known for high risk of riverine and urban flooding. The presence of […]
title: Toronto Flood-Prone Area to Get $323M in Federal and City Funding

description: The site was still working normally in Brazil on Aug. 30, but the platform went offline a day later.
title: Elon Musk’s X Officially Down in Brazil After Judge’s Shutdown Order

description: The Toronto Zoo says it has determined how one of its orangutans managed to briefly escape from its outdoor habitat on Thursday evening. In an update on Saturday, Aug. 31, the zoo said videos and photos sent by members of the public who visited the orangutans’ enclosure on the evening of Aug. 29 helped it […]
title: Orangutan Escaped by Swinging in ‘Cartwheel-Like Motion’ and Climbing Down Tower: Toronto Zoo

description: Early Sunday, Israel announced it had discovered the remains of six hostages in Gaza killed shortly before an Israeli operation that would have rescued them.
title: Protests Erupt, Strikes Planned in Israel After Hostage Deaths

description: PARIS—Paralympic triathlon competitions in Paris scheduled for Sunday have been postponed because of concerns about water quality in the Seine River after heavy rainfall, organizers said. The 11 para triathlon events are now scheduled for Monday, if upcoming water testing allows, the Paris 2024 organizing committee and World Triathlon said in a joint statement. Rainstorms […]
title: Paralympic Triathlon Events Postponed Due to Poor Water Quality in Seine River

description: The U.S. State Department and ambassadors from the UK, Australia, New Zealand, and Japan have condemned new escalations by Beijing in the South China Sea.
title: US, Others Condemn China After New Vessel Collision With Philippine Ship

description: JERUSALEM—Israel said early Sunday that it had recovered the bodies of six hostages captured during the Hamas terrorist group’s Oct. 7 attack that ignited the Gaza war, including Israeli-American Hersh Goldberg-Polin, whose parents had led a high-profile campaign for the captives’ release. The military said the six were murdered by Hamas shortly before Israeli forces […]
title: What We Know About the 6 Hostages Who Were Murdered in Gaza

description: Israelis gather outside the government compound in Tel Aviv, Israel, at 12 p.m. ET on Sep. 1 to demand an immediate deal with the Hamas terrorist group, after six of its hostages held in Gaza since Oct. 7, 2023, were killed and their bodies retrieved earlier on Sunday.
title: LIVE NOW: Protesters in Tel Aviv Demand Deal With Hamas After Hostage Deaths

description: A 4.6 magnitude earthquake rumbled through parts of Quebec early Sunday morning. Natural Resources Canada says the quake struck at 5:43 a.m, and was “lightly felt” in Drummondville, Trois-Rivières and Montreal. It hit 26 kilometres northwest of Drummondville, 35 kilometres from Trois-Rivières and 91 kilometres from Montreal. There were no immediate reports of damage. The […]
title: Mild Earthquake Rattles Three Quebec Cities, No Damage Reported

description: Israeli mourners gather in Tel Aviv, Israel, at 11 a.m. ET on Sep.1 to light candles and mourn six more hostages who were killed in captivity in Gaza by the Hamas terrorist group.
title: LIVE NOW: Israeli Mourners Hold Vigil for 6 Hostages Killed in Gaza

description: Hundreds gather at the funeral in Raanana, Israel, for Almog Sarusi, an Israeli hostage killed in Hamas captivity, at 10 a.m. ET on Sep. 1.
title: Israeli Mourners Hold Funeral for Hostage Killed in Gaza

description: Jacques Marchildon says sprinklers were the nail in the coffin for Villa Marie-Ange, the 14-person seniors residence he co-owns in St-Adelphe, Que. In the coming months, the two-storey building in the Mauricie region between Montreal and Quebec City will be put up for sale and the people currently living there will all be moved elsewhere. […]
title: Some Quebec Seniors Homes Struggle to Stay Afloat Due to Regulations, Rising Costs

description: The hostages had been 'brutally murdered by Hamas terrorists shortly before we reached them,' the IDF spokesperson said.
title: Israel: Bodies Recovered After Hamas Murders 6 Hostages Near Recent Tunnel Rescue

description: The risk to small, low-lying island nations in the Pacific posed by climate change dominated the agenda at this year's Pacific Islands Forum leaders meeting.
title: Pacific Islands Forum Members Pledge ‘Solidarity’ in the Face of Economic, Climate Challenges

description: Fortescue said it is pursuing the opportunity to jointly develop a fully-integrated Australia-China green metal supply chain.
title: Fortescue to Focus on Green Metal Export to China Over the Long Term

description: Hersh Goldberg-Polin was among the bodies of six hostages that the Israel Defense Forces said it had recently recovered from an underground tunnel in Gaza.
title: Israeli-American Held Hostage by Hamas Has Been Killed, Family Confirms

description: LONDON—Some Oasis fans celebrated like a champagne supernova, while others looked back in anger Saturday on Saturday as online ticket sites strained under demand for the band’s first shows for 15 years. The Britpop-era behemoth led by brothers Noel and Liam Gallagher is scheduled to play 17 gigs in Cardiff, Manchester, London, Edinburgh and Dublin […]
title: Error Messages and Lengthy Online Queues Frustrate Fans Scrambling to Secure Oasis Reunion Tickets

description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates—Yemen’s Houthi terrorists fired two missiles targeting a Liberian-flagged container ship in the Gulf of Aden, though the projectiles splashed down nearby without causing any damage, authorities said Saturday. The attack comes after the Houthis repeatedly assaulted and then boarded a Greek-flagged oil tanker in the nearby Red Sea, planting explosives on […]
title: Yemen’s Houthi Terrorists Fire 2 Missiles at a Container Ship as an Oil Tanker Burns

description: The Bureau of Meteorology issued a major flood warning for the river on Sunday morning, with property, livestock, equipment, and crops all likely to be threatened by floodwaters. Emergency services responded to 330 incidents in the 24 hours to 8 a.m. on Sunday, with a host of warnings issued for extreme weather expected for the […]
title: Major Flood Warning as Severe Weather Pounds Tasmania

description: Commentary We need to talk about Julie Sweeney. She’s a 53-year-old English woman who used to live in Church Lawton, Cheshire, and she once had a Facebook account. Today, she’s in prison, serving a 15-month sentence after being convicted under new Criminal Code provisions in the United Kingdom’s Online Safety Act. From all available accounts, […]
title: Peter Menzies: UK’s Online Safety Act May Be the Canary in the Coalmine for Canada Under Online Harms Act

description: The Albanese government has tried to incentivise states to clear red tape and put more investment towards building houses as Australians are priced out of a surging market. Opposition infrastructure spokeswoman Bridget McKenzie flagged federal infrastructure funding as a lever to put pressure on states to stump up on housing with the crisis getting “worse […]
title: Opposition Flags Funding Block for States Failing to Build Homes

description: Chung Pui-kuen and Patrick Lam have been convicted over 11 articles they wrote, which the CCP regime found to be 'seditious.'
title: Australia ‘Deeply Concerned’ by Imprisonment of Hong Kong Journalists

description: 'Now, the cost of living is number one. This policy is a bit a bit warped. It's very out of touch,' said Liberal MP Garth Hamilton.
title: Westpac Bank Criticised for Offering Lower Interest Rate for EV Loans

description: Early voting is about to start in a very contentious and unusual election season. On Sept. 6, voters in the battleground state of North Carolina can start mailing in their ballots; two dozen more states will join them as we roll through September. So far, we’ve had one presidential debate, after which the incumbent was […]
title: Life After the Election: Finding Unity Across the Party Divide
